cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift north-northwest tonight, make landfall near the South/North Carolina border on Sunday, then curve northeast just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast and accelerate past New Jersey toward the Gulf of Maine and Atlantic Canada by mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast near the South Santee River-Myrtle Beach area, SC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina and North Carolina coasts this weekend with expanding impacts (rain, gusty winds, rough surf) northward along the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts early next week
weather_observation.wind: Gusty east to northeast winds 25-35 mph with occasional higher gusts possible Tuesday as the storm passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible at times of high tide (generally below 2 ft).
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain Monday night into Tuesday totaling 1-3 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey shore; possible brief marine operational interruptions due to elevated seas.
